content:
I later added a variable-time inversion https://github.com/mratsim/constantine/blob/1c5341fd7e8af9084223b5bce616b4a8262eab14/constantine/math/arithmetic/limbs_exgcd.nim#L684

It's significantly faster than GMP.

author: chfast
content: Good docs, thanks. I wonder if this is implementable in EVM.

author: mratsim
content: The main speedup of both Bernstein-Yang (libsecp256k1 and Constantine) and Pornin (BLST and Gnark) algorithms is doing the computations on 62 bits at a time instead of the full 254 bits.

author: chfast
content: For EVM we want exactly the opposite: use 256-bit values preferably.
